title: Authors and Citation
text: Justin Grimmer. Author. Marble. Author. Cole Tanigawa-Lau. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Grimmer J, Marble W, Tanigawa-Lau C (2023). blocs: Estimate Visualize Voting Blocs' Partisan Contributions. R package version 0.1.1.9000, https://coletl.github.io/blocs/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {blocs: Estimate and Visualize Voting Blocs' Partisan Contributions},   author = {Justin Grimmer and Will Marble and Cole Tanigawa-Lau},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.1.1.9000},   url = {https://coletl.github.io/blocs/}, }

what: Estimate and Visualize Voting Blocs' Partisan Contributions
title: Estimate and Visualize Voting Blocs' Partisan Contributions
text: package defines functions combine data voting blocs’ size, turnout, vote choice estimate bloc’s vote contributions Democratic Republican parties. package also includes functions uncertainty estimation plotting. Users may define voting blocs along discrete continuous variable. package implements methods described Grimmer, Marble, Tanigawa-Lau (2022).

title: Estimate and Visualize Voting Blocs' Partisan Contributions
Estimate and Visualize Voting Blocs' Partisan Contributions
code: library(blocs) data(anes)  anes20 <- anes[anes$year == 2020, ]  # Define voting blocs along a discrete variable, race # pass to dv_vote3 the column coding vote choice: -1 = Democrat, 0 = third-party, 1 = Republican, and NA for no vote. # pass to dv_turnout the column coding voter turnout: 0 = no vote, 1 = voted vb_race <- vb_discrete(anes20, indep = "race", dv_vote3 = "vote_pres3", dv_turnout = "voted")  # Define voting blocs along a continuous variable, age  # Kernel density estimation prohibits missing values in the independent variable vb_age <- vb_continuous(anes20[!is.na(anes20$age), ],                          indep = "age", dv_vote3 = "vote_pres3", dv_turnout = "voted")  # Bootstrap uncertainty vb_out <-      vb_discrete(anes20, indep = "race", dv_vote3 = "vote_pres3", dv_turnout = "voted",                  boot_iters = 10)  vb_summary(vb_out)

what: Sample of 2020 ANES cumulative data file — anes
title: Sample of 2020 ANES cumulative data file — anes
text: Selected columns American National Election Studies' 2020 cumulative data file. final column example three-valued variable voting behavior, passed `dv_vote3` argument,

title: Sample of 2020 ANES cumulative data file — anes
Sample of 2020 ANES cumulative data file — anes
text: data frame 68,224 rows 13 columns: year election year respid respondent identifier weight survey weight race respondent race gender respondent gender educ respondent education level age respondent age voted respondent's voter turnout vote_pres respondent's presidential vote vote_pres_dem flag indicating Democratic presidential vote choice vote_pres_rep flag indicating Republican presidential vote choice vote_pres3 Three-valued voting behavior DV coded follows: -1 Democrat vote choice, 0 third-party vote, 1 Republican vote choice, NA vote.

title: Sample of 2020 ANES cumulative data file — anes
text: https://electionstudies.org/data-center/anes-time-series-cumulative-data-file/

title: Validator for class vbdf — check_vbdf
text: Validator class vbdf

title: Validator for class vbdf — check_vbdf
text: x object check tolerance tolerance used checking range probability estimates

title: Estimate density — estimate_density
text: Run kde weighted density estimation  x n_points evenly spaced points min max.

title: Estimate density — estimate_density
code: estimate_density(x, min, max, n_points = 100, w = NULL, ...)

title: Estimate density — estimate_density
text: x numeric vector matrix min numeric vector giving lower bound evaluation points variable x max numeric vector giving upper bound evaluation points variable x n_points number evaluation points (estimates) w vector weights. Default uses uniform weighting. ... arguments pass kde

title: Constructor for class vbdf — new_vbdf
text: Constructor class vbdf

title: Constructor for class vbdf — new_vbdf
text: x data.frame bloc_var character vector naming variables define voting blocs var_type string, type, discrete continuous

title: Constructor for vbdf summaries — new_vbsum
text: Constructor vbdf summaries

title: Constructor for vbdf summaries — new_vbsum
text: x data.frame uncertainty summary bloc_var string, name variable defines voting blocs var_type string, type variable, discrete continuous summary_type string, type variable, discrete continuous resamples numeric, number bootstrap resamples

title: Constructor for vbdf summaries — new_vbsum
text: vbsum object

title: Continuous voting bloc analysis — vb_continuous
text: Define voting blocs along continuous variable estimate partisan vote contributions.

title: Continuous voting bloc analysis — vb_continuous
code: vb_continuous(   data,   data_density = data,   data_turnout = data,   data_vote = data,   indep,   dv_vote3,   dv_turnout,   weight = NULL,   min_val = NULL,   max_val = NULL,   n_points = 100,   boot_iters = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   tolerance = sqrt(.Machine$double.eps),   ... )

title: Continuous voting bloc analysis — vb_continuous
text: data default data.frame use source density, turnout, vote choice data. data_density data.frame blocs' composition/density data. Must include columns named indep weight. data_turnout data.frame blocs' turnout data. Must include columns named dv_turnout, indep weight. data_vote data.frame blocs' vote choice data. Must include columns named dv_vote3, indep, weight. indep string, column name independent variable defining discrete voting blocs. dv_vote3 string, column name dependent variable data_vote, coded follows: -1 Democrat vote choice, 0 third-party vote, 1 Republican vote choice, NA vote. dv_turnout string, column name dependent variable flagging voter turnout data_turnout. column must coded 0 =  vote, 1 = voted. weight optional string naming column sample weights. min_val numeric vector length indep, Lower bound density estimation respective indep. See [estimate_density]. max_val numeric vector length indep, Upper bound density estimation respective indep. See [estimate_density]. n_points scalar, number points estimate density. See [estimate_density]. boot_iters integer, number bootstrap iterations uncertainty estimation. default FALSE equivalent 0 estimate uncertainty. verbose logical, whether print iteration number. tolerance tolerance used checking range probability estimates ... arguments pass kde density estimation.

title: Continuous voting bloc analysis — vb_continuous
text: vbdf data.frame columns resample, bloc variable, , resample-bloc combination, four estimates: probability density, turnout, Republican vote choice conditional turnout, net Republican votes.

what: Calculate differences in bloc contributions — vb_difference
title: Calculate differences in bloc contributions — vb_difference
text: Use vbdf output calculate differences blocs' net Republican vote contributions.

title: Calculate differences in bloc contributions — vb_difference
code: vb_difference(   vbdf,   estimates = grep("prob|pr_turnout|pr_votedem|pr_voterep|cond_rep|net_rep",     names(vbdf), value = TRUE),   sort_col = "year",   tolerance = sqrt(.Machine$double.eps) )

title: Calculate differences in bloc contributions — vb_difference
text: vbdf data.frame holding results voting bloc analyses. estimates character vector naming column(s) vbdf compute differences. sort_col character vector naming column(s) vbdf use sorting calling diff. tolerance tolerance used checking range probability estimates

title: Calculate differences in bloc contributions — vb_difference
text: vbdf object, plus two types columns: column named estimates, column named diff_* containing difference estimate across sort_col values, comp, contains string tag rows compared (e.g., 2020-2016), vbdf object.

title: Discrete voting bloc analysis — vb_discrete
text: Define voting blocs along discrete variable estimate partisan vote contributions.

title: Discrete voting bloc analysis — vb_discrete
code: vb_discrete(   data,   data_density = data,   data_turnout = data,   data_vote = data,   indep,   dv_vote3,   dv_turnout,   weight = NULL,   boot_iters = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   check_discrete = TRUE )

title: Discrete voting bloc analysis — vb_discrete
text: data default data.frame use source density, turnout, vote choice data. data_density data.frame blocs' composition/density data. Must include columns named indep weight. data_turnout data.frame blocs' turnout data. Must include columns named dv_turnout, indep weight. data_vote data.frame blocs' vote choice data. Must include columns named dv_vote3, indep, weight. indep string, column name independent variable defining discrete voting blocs. dv_vote3 string, column name dependent variable data_vote, coded follows: -1 Democrat vote choice, 0 third-party vote, 1 Republican vote choice, NA vote. dv_turnout string, column name dependent variable flagging voter turnout data_turnout. column must coded 0 =  vote, 1 = voted. weight optional string naming column sample weights. boot_iters integer, number bootstrap iterations uncertainty estimation. default FALSE equivalent 0 estimate uncertainty. verbose logical, whether print iteration number. check_discrete logical, whether check indep discrete variable.

title: Discrete voting bloc analysis — vb_discrete
text: vbdf object.

what: Plot the summary of a voting bloc analysis — vb_plot
title: Plot the summary of a voting bloc analysis — vb_plot
text: Plot summary voting bloc analysis

title: Plot the summary of a voting bloc analysis — vb_plot
code: vb_plot(   data,   x_col = get_bloc_var(data),   y_col,   ymin_col,   ymax_col,   discrete = length(unique(data[[x_col]])) < 20 )

title: Plot the summary of a voting bloc analysis — vb_plot
text: data vbsum data.frame, result [vb_summary]. x_col string naming column defines voting blocs. y_col string naming column point estimates. ymin_col string naming column plot lower bound confidence interval. ymax_col string naming column plot upper bound confidence interval. discrete logical indicating whether voting blocs defined along discrete (continuous) variable.

title: Plot the summary of a voting bloc analysis — vb_plot
text: ggplot object

what: Summarize uncertainty for a vbdf objects — vb_summary
title: Summarize uncertainty for a vbdf objects — vb_summary
text: Summarize uncertainty vbdf objects. Analysis must run bootstrap iterations. vb_uncertainty just alias vb_summary.

title: Summarize uncertainty for a vbdf objects — vb_summary
code: vb_summary(   object,   type = c("discrete", "continuous", "binned"),   estimates = grep("prob|pr_turnout|pr_votedem|pr_voterep|cond_rep|net_rep",     names(object), value = TRUE),   na.rm = FALSE,   funcs = c("mean", "median", "low", "high"),   low_ci = 0.025,   high_ci = 0.975,   bin_col,   tolerance = sqrt(.Machine$double.eps) )  vb_uncertainty(   object,   type = c("discrete", "continuous", "binned"),   estimates = grep("prob|pr_turnout|pr_votedem|pr_voterep|cond_rep|net_rep",     names(object), value = TRUE),   na.rm = FALSE,   funcs = c("mean", "median", "low", "high"),   low_ci = 0.025,   high_ci = 0.975,   bin_col,   tolerance = sqrt(.Machine$double.eps) )

title: Summarize uncertainty for a vbdf objects — vb_summary
text: object vbdf object, usually output [vb_discrete], [vb_continuous], [vb_difference]. type string naming type independent variable summary. Use "binned" using output [vb_continuous] plus binned version continuous bloc variable. estimates character vector naming columns calculate uncertainty estimates. na.rm logical indicating whether remove NA values estimates. funcs character vector summary functions apply estimates. Alternatively, supply list functions, accept numeric vector input return scalar. low_ci numeric. include string "low" funcs, use argument control lower bound confidence interval. high_ci numeric. include string "high" funcs, use argument control upper bound confidence interval. bin_col character vector naming column(s) define bins. Used  type "binned". tolerance tolerance used checking range probability estimates

title: Summarize uncertainty for a vbdf objects — vb_summary
text: summary object additional columns combination   estimates funcs.

title: Create a vbdf object — vbdf
text: Create vbdf object holding bloc-level estimates composition, turnout, /vote choice. function mostly internal use, may want create vbdf object voting bloc analysis. valid vbdf object can used [vb_difference] [vb_plot].

title: Create a vbdf object — vbdf
code: vbdf(   data,   bloc_var,   var_type = c("discrete", "continuous"),   tolerance = sqrt(.Machine$double.eps) )

title: Create a vbdf object — vbdf
text: data data.frame voting-bloc results convert vbdf object bloc_var string, name variable defines voting blocs var_type string, type variable, discrete continuous tolerance tolerance used checking range probability estimates

title: Create a vbdf object — vbdf
text: vbdf object.

what: Weighted frequency table or proportions — wtd_table
title: Weighted frequency table or proportions — wtd_table
text: Weighted frequency table proportions

title: Weighted frequency table or proportions — wtd_table
code: wtd_table(   ...,   weight = NULL,   na.rm = FALSE,   prop = FALSE,   return_tibble = FALSE,   normwt = FALSE )

title: Weighted frequency table or proportions — wtd_table
text: ... vectors class factor character, list/data.frame vectors. weight optional vector weights. default uses uniform weights 1. na.rm logical, whether remove NA values. prop logical, whether return proportions counts. Default returns counts. return_tibble logical, whether return tibble named vector. normwt logical, whether normalize weights sum 1.

title: Weighted frequency table or proportions — wtd_table
text: vector tibble counts proportions group
